main event: A fabricator with the Continental Steel Corporation in Kokomo, Indiana reported seeing a grayish metal disc-shaped object about 50 feet in diameter and 10-15 feet thick in the sky on April 8, 1950.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for a few minutes and then rotated slowly on its perpendicular axis.
Three small portholes on the object showed a blue-white light from within.
After hovering for several minutes, the object rose soundlessly and without taking off, and moved away to the north at a speed approximately three times that of an aircraft.
The witness could not provide any further information about the size, appearance, or operation of the object.
The report was forwarded to the Headquarters of the Fifth Army in Chicago, and then to the Director of Intelligence at Headquarters, USAF in Washington, D.C.
